info.title: Tampa.dev Platform API
info.description: The Tampa.dev Platform API provides authenticated access to community data including user profiles, events, groups, badges, and more. Authenticate with Personal Access Tokens (PATs) or OAuth 2.0 bearer tokens. All authenticated endpoints are under `/v1/`.

post.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) endpoint using Streamable HTTP transport (spec version `2025-03-26`). Accepts JSON-RPC 2.0 requests for MCP protocol methods. Supports batch requests (up to 10). Notifications (requests without `id`) return 204 No Content.

**Supported methods:**
- `initialize` â€” Capability negotiation and protocol version exchange
- `tools/list` â€” List available tools (filtered by token scopes)
- `tools/call` â€” Execute a tool with validated arguments
- `resources/list` â€” List available resources
- `resources/read` â€” Read a resource by URI
- `resources/templates/list` â€” List URI templates for parameterized resources
- `prompts/list` â€” List available prompt templates
- `prompts/get` â€” Get a prompt template with arguments
- `ping` â€” Health check

**Headers:** Include `Mcp-Session-Id` to maintain session context (echoed back in response).

200.description: JSON-RPC 2.0 response (single `JsonRpcResponse` object or batch array). Per JSON-RPC 2.0, errors also return 200 with an `error` field.

schema.description: JSON-RPC 2.0 response â€” see JsonRpcResponse schema

204.description: No Content â€” notification processed (no response body)

401.description: Unauthorized â€” missing or invalid authentication

get.description: Server-Sent Events endpoint for server-initiated messages. Not implemented â€” use `POST /mcp` for all MCP communication.

400.description: Bad Request â€” SSE not supported

delete.description: Terminates an MCP session. Sessions are stateless on the server side, so this is a no-op that always returns 204.
